result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah Isaiah Norman

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Violation Report ( missed office contact).

ADOURNED OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Jeremiah I Norman appeared by video.  
Attorney Theodore O'Reilly for Sylvan Jaspen in court for Jeremiah I Norman.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Bail Bond Hearing.
Court informed defense counsel in trial in a different court and request an adjournment.
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Jeremiah Isaiah Norman appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Jeremiah Isaiah Norman.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 22CF2426 and 22CF2610. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Warner. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah I Norman in court, in custody.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Jeremiah I Norman.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 


Case in court for return on doctors report. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  
State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Court  adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense. 
Court finds defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.  
Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing before Preliminary Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and filed.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Jeremiah Isaiah Norman not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 7.22.2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeremiah Isaiah Norman in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jeremiah Isaiah Norman in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremiah Isaiah Norman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case (22CF2426) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with K.A. Kemnitz; J.N. Warner
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
